titleStmt.title: The humble desires of Prince Rupert, Prince Maurice, and others their adherents, to the Kings Most Excellent Majestie, to be tryed at a counsell of war. Together with His Majesties letter to Colonel Samuel Sands Governour of Worcester, concerning the persons aforesaid.
titleStmt.author: Rupert, Prince, Count Palatine, 1619-1682.
Maurice, Prince, 1620-1652.
Sands, Samuel, Colonel.
England and Wales. Sovereign (1625-1649 : Charles I).

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for Edw. Husband, printer to the Honorable House of Commons, and are to be sold at his shop at the sign of the Golden Dragon in Fleetstreet neer the Inner-Temple,

notesStmt.note: The letter from Rupert and Maurice is signed by them and 21 others.
The letter from King Charles I is dated at end: Nov. 23. 1645.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.

place.placeName: his shop at the sign of the Golden Dragon in Fleetstreet neer the Inner-Temple
